title: Making the District of Columbia Safe and Beautiful

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the federal government to work closely with local officials to improve safety and cleanliness in Washington, D.C. It establishes a task force to combat crime, enhance law enforcement coordination, and protect monuments, while also developing a program to beautify public spaces and promptly remove graffiti and homeless encampments on federal lands in the city.
potential_concerns: Increased law enforcement presence and aggressive crime-fighting tactics may lead to over-policing and civil rights concerns, especially in marginalized communities.
The prompt removal of homeless encampments on federal lands could displace homeless individuals without providing adequate alternative housing or support services.
Stronger immigration enforcement efforts could create fear and uncertainty among undocumented immigrants and immigrant communities in the D.C. area.
Coordination among multiple federal and local agencies may face bureaucratic challenges, potentially limiting the effectiveness of the task force.
Efforts to strictly enforce laws on protests and demonstrations might restrict lawful free speech and political expression in public spaces.
